intro: Cabralea tomentosa, commonly known as the silky cabralea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
